page.title: 01 INTRODUCTION
page.content: This is a rural area of Derbyshire. There is one village, Kirk Ireton, two hamlets, Ireton Wood and Biggin by Hulland and several scattered farms. The block is on the southern edge of the Pennines with grassy hills, stone buildings, thick hedgerows and a few stone walls. A lot of the buildings are quite old. Some have been modernised and a number of new ones have been built, but there has not been a lot of development compared with some places. There have been a greater changes in people's life styles. A lot of people have moved out of the city and towns to live in the village. They travel to work, not like the old days when most people worked on farms. A few houses are now holiday cottages and if the Carsington reservoir is built, more tourism should result.
